result.execSummary:
The defendant Safi S. Salameh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • WIC - Provide Cash for Drafts, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 253.06(4)(a)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Safi S. Salameh in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
On State's motion, Court ordered COUNTS 3, 4, and 5 DISMISSED and read in.   As to COUNTS 1 and 2:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 3 years, concurrent WITH COUNT 2 and with any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 18 MONTHS with credit for 1 day
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS.

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years with the following conditions:
*Court imposed but STAYED 60 days condition time in the HOC, release privilege for work, to be used by agent for any violations.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Pay restitution in the amount of $27,181.62 (owed to State of Wisconsin Department of Health Services) within term of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

COUNT 2:  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 2 years, concurrent WITH COUNT 1 and with any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1 YEAR with credit for 1 day
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR.

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years with the following conditions:
*
Court imposed but STAYED 60 days condition time in the HOC, release privilege for work, to be used by agent for any violations.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Pay restitution in the amount of $27,181.62 (owed to State of Wisconsin Department of Health Services) within term of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

COURT ORDERED THAT THE DEFENDANT'S PASSPORT BE RETURNED TO HIM.

All parties are notified that effective August 4, 2014, this case will be assigned to:  Judge POCAN, Branch 26, in ROOM 634 of the COURTHOUSE.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice.  kmw

Defendant Safi S. Salameh in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  By agreement of the parties and with the Court's approval, 6/30 rescheduled.  Jury trial scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Safi S. Salameh in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Safi S. Salameh in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendants Passport surrendered to the Clerks Office per order of the Court this date. jew

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON FEBRUARY 14, 2014. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST. Court ordered that defendant surrender his passport. Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Safi S. Salameh in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/13/14 @ 1:30pm
